com.xhive.util.interfaces
Interface XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf

All Superinterfaces:
XhiveExternalDataLoaderIf
public interface XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf
extends XhiveExternalDataLoaderIf

Load SQL data from a JDBC source into a document.

An instance of this interface can be acquired through com.xhive.XhiveDriverFactory.getDriver().getSQLDataLoader(String userName, String password, String url)

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Method Summary
 void loadSQLData(java.lang.String select)
          Load the data selected by the SQL query and return it in a XML Document.
 void setDriver(java.lang.String jdbcdriver)
          Sets the jdbc driver to use, defaults to "sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver".
 
Methods inherited from interface com.xhive.util.interfaces.XhiveExternalDataLoaderIf
setColumn2Attribute, setColumnNames, setIgnoreColumns, setIgnoreHeader, setRowName, setTargetDocument
 

Method Detail

setDriver

void setDriver(java.lang.String jdbcdriver)
Sets the jdbc driver to use, defaults to "sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver".

Parameters:
jdbcdriver - the jdbcdriver driver to use instead of "sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver".

loadSQLData

void loadSQLData(java.lang.String select)
Load the data selected by the SQL query and return it in a XML Document.

You must call setTargetDocument(...) before calling this method.

Parameters:
select - the SQL query to use to get data from the jdbc source.
